text: The TriVette was an American three wheeled vehicle. It was designed and built in California by Bob Keyes from 1974 to 1978.http://www.thetrivette.com/HISTORY.HTMLhttps://www.hemmings.com/blog/2014/04/22/from- the-archives-bob-keyess-trivette/ The TriVette was designed to meet all state and federal motorcycle standards, but was enclosed like a saloon car.https://www.hemmings.com/blog/2014/04/22/from-the-archives-bob-keyess- trivette/ The running gear was mostly derived from a Fiat 850 with a turbo Volkswagen motor as an option.http://www.thetrivette.com/SPECS.HTML The TriVette achieved over 61 MPG and, unlike most three-wheelers, was known for its handling.https://www.hemmings.com/blog/2014/04/22/from-the-archives-bob- keyess-trivette/ Keyes also designed a larger V8 engined version, the Viglante, which out accelerated and out handled most supercars of the timehttp://www.vigillante.com/vigillante2.htm. Keyes died before the Viglante reached full production.https://www.hemmings.com/blog/2014/04/22/from-the- archives-bob-keyess- trivette/http://www.thetrivette.com/HISTORY.HTMLhttp://www.vigillante.com/topgear.htm ==References== == External links == * Official webpage * TriVette fan website * Top Gear article Category:Tricycle motorcycles Category:American motorcycles Category:Motorcycles introduced in the 1970s Category:1970s in transport Category:Motorcycle manufacturers of the United States
title: TriVette
